definition: to whisper and chat (instead of listening during a meeting or lecture)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to hold a meeting/to attend a meeting
to discuss guidelines/to discuss principles to be followed
a routine meeting of a squad/team or class
to talk officiously/to assume the air of a functionary/to talk in official jargon
to sing the high part/to speak fine sounding but empty words (idiom)
to hand over to the next workshift
